revised_title: Ab Initio S.C.F. Calculations and Photoelectron Spectroscopy of Alkaline Earth Halides
tldr: The authors used ab initio s.c.f. calculations and photoelectron spectroscopy to study the valence shell electronic structure of alkaline earth halides. They found that the heavier metal halides have a nonlinear geometry and that the metal orbital plays an important role in determining the molecular geometry. The study also showed that a point charge model can be used to fit the ionization potentials for these molecules.
